{"step_by_step_thinking": "Cystic fibrosis is indeed an autosomal recessive disorder, so option A is true. It is caused by a mutation in the cystic fibrosis transport regulator (CFTR), so option C is also true. However, the abnormality in CFTR leads to defective chloride transport, not calcium transport. Therefore, option B is not true.", "answer_choice": "B"}
